title: 110_s3734
content:
The Act is titled the "Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe Fish Springs Ranch Settlement Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act defines key terms such as "Agreement," "Environmental impact statement," "Final payment date," "Fish Springs," and "Project." The term "Project" refers to the pumping and transfer of up to 8,000 acre-feet of groundwater per year by Fish Springs, including an additional 5,000 acre-feet as per the Agreement. The term "Project" excludes the Intermountain Water Supply project and any other unspecified projects. The "record of decision" refers to the District Manager's decision on the environmental impact statement. The "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the "Tribe" refers to the Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe of Indians. The Paiute Tribe of Indians is organized under the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934. The Paiute Tribe of Indians is organized under the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934. SEC. 3. RATIFICATION OF AGREEMENT. The Agreement between the Paiute Tribe of Indians and the Secretary is ratified, with exceptions related to choice of law and waiver/retention of claims. The Agreement ratified between the Paiute Tribe of Indians and the Secretary will be carried out in accordance with section 4, with no major federal action under the National Environmental Policy Act. The Secretary will ensure compliance with all required Federal environmental activities and applicable laws. SEC. 4. WAIVER AND RELEASES OF CLAIMS. In executing the Agreement, the Tribe and the Secretary shall waive all claims against Fish Springs for damage or loss to water rights and claims related to the negotiation of the Agreement. The Tribe shall also waive any claims against the United States in relation to the Agreement. The curr_chunk discusses claims related to damage, loss, or injury to water, water rights, land, and other resources due to the use of water by Fish Springs under the Agreement for the Project. It also includes claims related to the record of decision, environmental impact statement, negotiation, execution, or adoption of the Agreement or the Act. The waivers and releases under the Agreement for the Project will take effect on specific dates. The Tribe and the Secretary will retain all claims for enforcement through legal remedies available in court. The Tribe retains rights to surface and groundwater, water rights, and claims related to water quality under various environmental laws. The Act waives rights under environmental laws such as the Safe Drinking Water Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The Agreement and this Act provide full satisfaction of all claims of the Tribe and the United States. The parties to the Agreement are the only beneficiaries, with no third-party beneficiary status. Civil actions related to the Agreement enforcement shall be filed in the United States District Court for the District of Nevada. SEC. 8. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS.

(a) Truckee-Carson-Pyramid Lake Water Rights Settlement Act.-- No impact on rights established in the Truckee-Carson-Pyramid Lake Water Rights Settlement Act.

(b) No Establishment of Standard.-- No standard set for Federal reserved water rights or Indian tribe claims in any legal proceedings.

(c) Other Claims.-- No adverse effects on water rights, claims, or entitlements of any Indian tribe, band, or community other than the Tribe.

SEC. 9. NULLIFICATION DATE.

If the Tribe fails to execute waivers described in section 4(b) within 90 days of enactment, the Agreement becomes void.
